result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan A. Sanders Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Uttering a Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ethan A. Sanders Perry

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 21CM685, 22CF89 are called at 1:34 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Ethan A. Sanders Perry appeared by phone from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Ethan A. Sanders Perry. Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense indicates the State made a new offer today and requests time to discuss new offer with Defendant. Off the record: 1:35 PM-1:40 PM. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement and recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads guilty to 22cf69 Count 1- Uttering a Forgery and 21CM685 Count 1- Fraudulent Use of a Credit Card without Repeater. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court orders in 21CM685: 10 days jail with Huber and 4 days credit, Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and court costs. 
Court orders in 22CF69: 60 days jail with Huber and 2 days credit consecutive to 21CM685, but concurrent to Chippewa County case 20CF427, Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and court costs.
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Cases 21CM685, 22CF69 are called at 1:29 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Ethan A. Sanders Perry appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Zebulon Patek for Ethan A. Sanders Perry appeared by video separately, Attorney Trenton John Piltz for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense acknowledges receipt of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts in both cases. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. 
Court accepts Not Guilty pleas in both cases. 
Status Conference: 05/02/2022 at 1:30 PM (set for 1/2 hour- IN PERSON)

9:45 AM Cases called: 21CM685 & 22CF69 Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ethan A. Sanders Perry appeared by video, in custody, from the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared in court for Ethan A. Sanders Perry. 
22CF69: Defendant waives right to a Preliminary Hearing freely and voluntarily with the advice of counsel. 
Both cases are referred to Br. 3 for scheduling.
Notice of Hearing, Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, No Mail Receptacle, Unable to Forward

records.addlTxt:
11:07 AM cases 21CM685 and 22CF69  called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ethan A. Sanders Perry appeared by video, in custody. Warrant is quashed in 21CM865. 
In 22CF69: Defense waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. Defendant is eligible for SPD representation. 
Both files: Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 2-7-22 at 1:15 PM. Return to court: 2-28-22 at 9:30 AM.
